intro: Duhamelia patens, commonly known as the slender duhamelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Duhamelia patens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
